pros: This organization has a lot of pride for the services they provide their communities. They are good at taking care of each other and the associates. But they excel at taking care of patients. You have a sense of pride for being a part of a team that cares so much.

review_title: Great  organization with a true commitment to the patients it serves.
pros: Flexibility. I work with a great team and I am motivated by the mission of the organization.
cons: I wish we had more PTO.

review_title: Excellent place to work. Committed to associates, patients, and communities of Georgia
pros: CHSGa is a great place to work. The culture, flexibility, mission, vision, and values of the organization provide a framework to do your best work.
cons: Sometimes meeting people is hard because we are all over the place but the people are friendly and welcoming. Zoom is always a great option.

pros: Very big organization with good perks
cons: Very rude people in every department also they don't have enough experience and education

job_title: Director of Communications in Macon, GA
pros:
-wide geographic footprint
-diversity of services
-culture of caring
-high standards
cons: I cannot think of any "con" of working for a service delivery of CHSGa.
